title: Ticket #5075: Many Core machines not detecting all cores on Windows
description:
We have a user with 24 Core Xeon E5-2690 running Windows were HTCondor is only detecting 12 of the 24 cores.

This is because in preparation for handling machines with > 64 processors. Microsoft has created a new concept called 'processor groups'. They guarantee that the maximum number of processors in a processor group will always be less than 64 - But a program that calls GetLogicalProcessorInformation will only learn about processors in the same group as the thread making the call. In order to find out about ALL processors, you must now call GetLogicalProcessorInformationEx. See this for more info. https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd405503
